newsitem.title: USA: Star to shut Texas hydrocraker Saturday.
newsitem.headline: Star to shut Texas hydrocraker Saturday.

text.p: Star Enterprise said Friday it would shut a 15,000 barrel per day hydrocracker at its 235,000 bpd refinery in Port Arthur, Texas, for an unplanned repair.

"We're shutting down the hydrocracker to do some unscheduled repair, which means we will be making more heating oil and distillates, which is what we probably should be doing anyway," said Mike Killien, manager of the refinery.
Killien said he expected the hydrocracker to be down "for 10 days to two weeks," adding the unit had been returned to service earlier this week after a previous three-week turnaround.
"It just recently was started up," said Killien, who declined to specify the exact nature of the problem.
-- Ransdell Pierson, New York Energy Desk 212 859-1632
